availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Angelina Taul Poynter. Father of Sally Poynter, Margaret Poynter, James W Poynter, John D Poynter, Susan B Poynter, Willaim H Poynter, Robert H. Poynter and Mary Poynter. Employed as a farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Employed as a farmer in Franklin County in 1870.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 163
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, p. 480
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Forks of Elkhorn, p. 77A
Find A Grave, "Thomas Poynter (1812-1901)," Memorial #61503409, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61503409 (accessed February 12, 2019).
